meanings.definition: A member of the Muslim dynasty of Mongol origin that ruled India in the 16th to 19th centuries.
meanings.sent1: The young boy learned about the Moghul rulers in his history class.
meanings.sent2: The Moghul dynasty left a lasting impact on Indian history.
meanings.sent3: The Moghul prince rode on his majestic horse through the palace gates.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the Moghul king's wisdom was as vast as the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The intricate Moghul architecture amazed visitors from around the world.

meanings.definition: A powerful or influential person, especially in business or industry.
meanings.sent1: The successful entrepreneur was considered a Moghul in the tech industry.
meanings.sent2: She admired the Moghul of the fashion world for their innovative designs.
meanings.sent3: The office Moghul always had the best ideas for team-building activities.
meanings.sent4: Her negotiation skills made her a Moghul in the real estate market.
meanings.sent5: The young apprentice aspired to become a Moghul in the business world one day.
